questions.question_text: A recent ransomware attack caused several datasets to be inaccessible. Security technicians were able to mitigate any additional attacks and remove any unauthorized software. Which of the following should the technicians do NEXT?

comments.content: Agreed. Ransomware in most cases make data unrecoverable and the most important strategy to deal with the threat is frequent back ups.

update the software firewall is definately part if the seven steps.
Please seel below:
CompTIA has identified a seven-step best practice procedure for malware removal:
1. Identify and research malware symptoms.
2. Quarantine infected systems.
3. Disable System Restore (in Windows).
4. Remediate infected systems:
• Update anti-malware software.
• Scan and use removal techniques (Safe Mode, Pre-installation environment).
5. Schedule scans and run updates.
6. Enable System Restore and create restore point (in Windows).
7. Educate end user.

discussion.content: Update the software firewall? That's not even part of seven step malware removal process. Most likely correct answer should be restore from back up as the key term in question is file inaccessible.
Backup seems like it would be the best for restoring functionality as quickly as possible but not apart of the remediation steps but updates surely is the next step in malware removal.
Luego de remediar los sistema, se debe programar scaneos en este caso no esta la opcion de programas, entonces actualizar cortafuegos.
D is correct

Only reason I'd even suspect firewall is to prevent further attack through the network from outside the firewall, but the question never states how the infection started -- so if that is the answer, it's sorta out of left field.

Backup seems like a safe answer to choose.

comments.content: Wouldn't restoring from backup possibly reinfect the system?

questions.question_text: A user's smartphone takes longer to access websites than it did prior to a weeklong vacation. The user also observes the smartphone no longer says LTE in the corner of the screen, but it has significant improvements in speed when connected to a local hotspot. Which of the following is the cause of the symptoms the smartphone is experiencing?

comments.content: yea but weak signal can also drop your generation from 5G to 4G and so forth. I didnt notice it until I went into an area with bad reception...my phone said 4G and i have a 5G phone.

discussion.content:
I don't think this is B.
When you use up all your data allowance your provider will often restrict your access to 4G (LTE) and put you on 3g or even 2g until you buy more data, or reach the next billing period. 

Therefore I think C is the answer.

They are still receiving signal, just not lte. I read if someone is getting 3g instead of lte when they have an unlimited plan it could be due to a weak signal (the example says trees or objects in between the cellphone and towers can make this happen).Even cellphone providers state after you reach their limit you will still get lte (although it might be throttled)

Selected Answer: B
correct answer is B.
The correct answerr is B. becasue the question said the smartphone no longer says LTE in the corner. Using all of your data do not affects your signal. A bad signal got serious impact data
It worked before vacation prolly used his data

questions.question_text: An end user who travels frequently receives a lot of spam and ransomware emails. The user has asked a technician to help ensure the data is secure and duplicated regularly without the need for equipment. Which of the following would be the BEST method?

discussion.content: The need to backup regularly, keeping the data safe without the use of additional device, brings to think cloud storage is the best option as gives the chance to have backups off site meeting all the requirements

questions.question_text: A user needs to transfer some information from a work computer to a server. The user plugs a personal USB into the computer but is denied access to save information on the storage medium due to the security policy. This is an example of:

discussion.content: Data Loss Prevention (DLP) uses IDS, IPS, and/or SIEM to detect data leakage. I'm guessing that the security policy made it so that no one would be able to easily transfer data from a computer to something like a USB flash drive.

Agree DLP makes the most sense here. 

Those saying A, in terms of the A+ exam "port security" has to do with networking ports IE blocking port 80, not a USB "port"
its denied access to 'SAVE' information, ...to me thats DLP
A please.
Should be 'A' ?

comments.content:
No.
Port security is another method of restricting hosts based on either their specific MAC
addresses or an allowable number of MAC addresses per the port. Port security is configured on the switch port(s) of a network switch.

questions.question_text: Which of the following OS types provides a lightweight option for workstations that need an easy-to-use browser-based interface?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Chrome OS is designed by Google and is known for its lightweight nature, simplicity, and focus on web-based applications.
Chrome OS
